thread.title: Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury
thread.title_full: Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury
text:
Photo: Nam Y. Huh, AP Image 1 of / 2   2 Chicago Cubs' Addison Russell (22) watches batting practice before Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. Chicago Cubs' Addison Russell (22) watches batting practice before Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. Photo: Nam Y. Huh, AP Image 2 of 2 Chicago Cubs' Addison Russell, right, talks to a trainers after hitting a triple against the St. Louis Cardinals during the fourth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. Chicago Cubs' Addison Russell, right, talks to a trainers after hitting a triple against the St. Louis Cardinals during the fourth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. ... more Photo: Nam Y. Huh, AP Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury 1  /  2 Back to Gallery CHICAGO (AP) â€” Cubs shortstop Addison Russell will not play in the NL Championship Series because of a strained left hamstring.
Manager Joe Maddon also says Jon Lester will start the series opener on Saturday night, followed by Jake Arrieta in Game 2 on Sunday. Lester is 6-5 with a 2.66 ERA in 15 career postseason games, including 13 starts.
The Cubs will find out their opponent for the next round when the Dodgers host the New York Mets in Game 5 of their division series on Thursday night.
Russell left Game 3 of the NLDS against the Cardinals due to tightness in his left hamstring. Maddon says it's a moderate strain, and the team will be pragmatic with the injury.
Javier Baez , who replaced Russell after he left in the previous round, will be the starting shortstop in the NLCS.
